result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Lamonte Terry Kazee in court.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Lamonte Terry Kazee in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Case was incorrectly assigned to Judge Kies Br. 45. Case reassigned to Judge Childs Br. 2.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7.6.2022

Defendant Lamonte Terry Kazee in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Oak Creek Officer T. Wolff.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, Filed.

Defendant Lamonte Terry Kazee in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-24-22, Filed.  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFFS 5/14/2022
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Lamonte Terry Kazee in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Lamonte Terry Kazee in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
